TopicTitle: I really do love this game

Articles.Content:
Exactly like an ISS styled mission bringing and taking members to and from Earth, I did my first docked mission today where I transferred crew into my space station that, before hand, had nobody in it. (Without MechJeb, or any other docking mods)

In the 90 hours that I've played this game I've learned a lot, I've been to multiple planets and moons, and now I'm docking like a pro, and coming up with new ways to keep this exciting. My next goal is to establish a Mun base.

Anyway I just wanted to say I really do love this game, and it was well worth the $25. I can't wait to see more from the Squad team, as well as the people who continue to add great Mods to this game!

I cannot agree more. I think it was Scott Manley who said that the game could be released as is, with only a few minor polishes and it would feel like a complete game. The fact that Squad keeps developing it is awesome, I can't wait to see what they come up with!
This game is SOOOO worth every penny paid for it. It's fun, it has a humorous factor, it's actually quite well polished, and there is so much to do!
KSP is such a fun game. It's something accessible to all but with so many possibilities of customization- I love it!
The game feels like a Technic Lego box, and I used to play a lot with that. Endless creativity; best game I've seen in years!
In fact, all it really needs is optimising to fix the framerate problems that everyone has and it would be even more awesome than it is now... but there is so much to come.
